description: This dense bottling, the second wine of Château Ausone, is rich both in tannins and dark berry fruits. Produced from selected parcels and young vines, the wine has rich tannins that are already melding smoothly into the structure and fruit. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Ausone 2016 La Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

winery: Château Certan de May de Certan
description: Poised and elegant, this wine comes from a 13.5-acre estate within stone-throwing distance of Pétrus. Its richness is sublimated by pure red-berry fruits and acidity to give a balanced wine with stylish tannins. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Certan de May de Certan 2016  Pomerol

description: Owned by the French national agricultural research institute, this property has seen great improvement in recent years. This wine's tannins are firm, sustaining the black-currant fruitiness that lies underneath. It will be an elegant wine. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Couhins 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: Partnered with Château Giscours as far as the winemaking team is concerned, this estate has created its own style. This wine shows a hint of initial austerity before opening out with rich fruits and structure. It needs time and the wine will not be ready to drink before 2025.
title: Château du Tertre 2016  Margaux

description: This second wine of Château Haut-Bailly offers a softer reflection of the power of the top wine. Generous tannins are already integrating with the rich fruits that come through strongly. The juicy blackberry character to this wine shows concentration. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2016 La Parde Haut-Bailly  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Under the same management as Château Léoville-Poyferré in Saint-Julien, this estate belongs to the Cuvelier family. With its structured Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is made to age. Big tannins and concentrated fruits are full and dense. It will be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Château Le Crock 2016  Saint-Estèphe

description: Ripe black fruits and rich tannins mark out this wine, almost entirely made from Merlot. It is succulent, crisp and fresh while not losing sight of the essential richness and structure of the vintage. Drink this generous, full wine from 2023.
title: Château l'Évangile 2016  Pomerol

description: The second wine of Château Pavie is dense with dark tannins and superripe fruit. Bold and concentrated it still highlights the fruitiness of the vintage. Although it has big tannins and great potential, the wine also shows plenty of freshness. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Pavie 2016 Arômes de Pavie  (Saint-Émilion)

description: With vineyards in the southern Margaux village of Cantenac, this estate has produced a deliciously juicy wine. The structure follows a straight line between the tannins and the intense fruit and acidity. The wine should age well, ready to drink from 2024.
title: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2016  Margaux

description: Lush and inviting aromas of baked black cherry, cola, cream and strawbery greet the nose on this impressive appellation blend by Winemaker Adam Lee. There is a lot of grip to the palate, where a ripe boysenberry jam flavor is elevated by spearmint and framed by stiff tannins.
title: Clarice 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Chalk soil on the slope up to the plateau above the town of Chinon gives this organic wine its mineral texture, which is allied to great fruit and spice. Wood aging lends generous, ripe tannins, the layers of black fruits are impressive and have aged well. Enjoy this fine wine now.
title: Domaine Olga Raffault 2014 Les Picasses  (Chinon)

description: Wild black-skinned berry, fragrant blue flower, cake spice and earthy whiffs of tilled soil and leather form the nose. Juicy and delicious, the smooth, full-bodied palate doles out layers of succulent black cherry, ripe plum, cinnamon and star offset with taut refined tannins, while fresh acidity lends tension. It's a fantastic Rosso, already accessible but will also offer good midterm aging. Drink through 2024.
title: Il Colle 2016  Rosso di Montalcino

designation: Lake William Estate Grown Cave Fermented
description: This blend of 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Cabernet Franc, 26% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot offers grip and structure within a leathery midpalate of robust texture and weight. Black pepper, currant and plum provide a subtle helping of fruit that lengthens and brightens the finish.
title: Jarvis 2013 Lake William Estate Grown Cave Fermented Red (Napa Valley)

description: This wine is plush, lush and fruity, interwoven with tones of cardamom and clove. The palate is rich in feel, bolstered by layers of orange peel, cassis and toasted oak flavors.
title: Jax 2016 72 Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Savory, earthy and herbaceous aromas lead to a crisp and vital palate that carries bright flavors of red cherry, pine and rhubarb. It is medium in weight, energized with acidity and light in tannins, while also nicely concentrated and focused.
title: Maryetta 2015 Valenti Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

description: This blends 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville, combining bold integrated flavors of cinnamon toast, sage, licorice and blackberry. Reduced and showing its oak, it has sinewy quality to the texture, and finishes with an unexpected freshness.
title: The Vineyard House 2014 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

description: This wine is impressively blended with 10% Cabernet Franc, showing a wealth of dusty plum, clove and cinnamon character up front and throughout. The fruit is predominantly from mountain vineyards. Soft, integrated texture shows its integration with the French oak, which supports instead of distracts.
title: Amici 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Youthful, this wine is blended with small amounts of Malbec, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Together, they form a core of earthy cedar, clove and pencil shavings, with a bite of thick tannin taking on a leathery texture. Dark cherry, black currant and dark chocolate melt on the palate into a velvety whole.
title: Amici 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Now with a brand-new, see-through glass winery, this estate is showing its true elegance. The wine does not have great power but it offers a ripe, smooth, sophisticated texture and black fruits. It already shows delicious flavors that will improve. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Beychevelle 2016  Saint-Julien

description: While not certified as such, this wine in effect comes from biodynamically grown grapes. It has great structure and pure black-currant fruits that are ripe while also very fresh. The tannins are still firm and dry and need time. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Cadet-Bon 2016  Saint-Émilion
